text: the big freeze is already biting hard
across a swathe of the American Midwest
and parts of Canada high winds and snow
already making any kind of getting
around difficult and in many places
treacherous and it's set to become a
good deal colder than this a polar
vortex as it's called by weather experts
bringing some of the lowest temperatures
in years hundreds of flights have
already been canceled and little wonder
officials are investigating a crash
landing at this snowy Airport at Aspen
Colorado one person was killed the
private jet came in to land flipped over
and burst into flames this plane skidded
off the runway at Chicago's O'Hare
Airport
this jet off a taxiway at New York's JFK
and the pilot of this light aircraft was
forced to land on a snow line New York
Highway the city of Indianapolis banned
anyone from driving other than in an
emergency or to seek shelter the last
time he did such a travel warning was in
1978 this weather combination that we're
seeing right now with all of the snow
and the cold is unlike anything that
we've seen in decades in this area and I
can't emphasize that enough the cold
really scares me but in Wisconsin no one
is going to let the extreme weather
prevent a key National Football League
playoff order Green Bay Packers and the
San Francisco 49ers from going at night
some fans went to extreme lengths to
fight the freeze for layers long johns
two sets of snow pants four shirts a
sweatshirt and a coach America is braced
for more of this and what's being called
a storm for the record books
Mike Wooldridge BBC News
